item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Duos Update Set to Land Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Bandai Namco and FromSoftware have announced when you can expect the Elden Ring Nightreign duos update to land, and it's not too far away at all, so get ready to revisit Limveld with your buddy.

Elden Ring Nightreign's duos mode was first revealed in early June, but now, the two studios have unveiled the date on which you'll be able to tackle Limveld's dangers with just one other person: July 30th.

The ability to play in a duo will be added as part of patch 1.02, which will also bring new ways to sort relics, hopefully making organizing your favorite loadouts a little easier.

As a reminder, Elden Ring Nightreign was released back in late May, quickly amassing over two million sales on its first day of release. At launch, the game only supported solo play or squads of three, and players quickly began requesting a duo mode, which FromSoftware was evidently happy to implement.

After release, Nightreign received a number of updates, adding features like new superpowered versions of the Nightlord bosses to take on, plus new quality-of-life improvements and more.

News of the duos update's release date comes shortly after Nightreign reached five million sales earlier this week, with Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC currently sitting at ten million. Those are some pretty encouraging numbers for Bandai Namco, I'm sure.

If you're not familiar with Elden Ring Nightreign, it's a multiplayer-focused spinoff of Elden Ring that sees players descending on a randomly-generated map in order to kill minibosses, loot gear, and get strong enough to take on a boss at the end of each run.

The game is one of two major multiplayer-oriented titles in FromSoftware's slate for the next couple of years; the other is The Duskbloods, a Switch 2-exclusive PvPvE game set to launch sometime next year.

In the meantime, you can check out Elden Ring Nightreign right now on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox, and you can read my review of the game right here.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
